dashboard.description: Monitors Kubernetes/OCP Clusters using Prometheus. Shows overall cluster CPU / Memory / Filesystem usage as well as individual pod, containers, systemd services statistics. Uses cAdvisor metrics only.

panels.title: Failed builds totals, per failure reason, (5 minutes)
Aggregate CPU usage of several systemd units (masters)
CPU consumed per node in the cluster.
CPU consumed per namespace on the cluster
CPU consumption per system service or container (infrastructure nodes. - top 10)

rows.title: System services CPU and process memory usage

panels.description: This number will include image pulls, so often will be hundreds of seconds.
panels.title: 90th percentile latency for docker operations (in microseconds).

panels.description: This number will include image pulls, so often will be hundreds of seconds.
panels.title: 90th percentile latency for docker operations (in microseconds).
The number of containers that start or restart over the last ten minutes.
Number of mutating API requests being made to the control plane.
Number of non-mutating API requests being made to the control plane.
Returns a running count (not a rate) of docker operations that have failed since the kubelet was started.

panels.description: Returns PLEG (pod lifecycle event generator) latency metrics. This represents the latency experienced by calls from the kubelet to the container runtime (i.e. docker or CRI-O). High PLEG latency is often related to disk I/O performance on the docker storage partition.
panels.title: PLEG (pod lifecycle event generator)
Returns the number of build that have been waiting at least 10 minutes (600 seconds) to start.
Returns the number of builds that have been running for more than 10 minutes (600 seconds).
Failed builds because of problems retrieving source from the associated Git repository.

dashboard.title: dashai - OpenShift Monitoring
